thread.title: Astros give All-Star Harris new 2-year deal
thread.title_full: Astros give All-Star Harris new 2-year deal

author: Manny Randhawa
title: Astros give All-Star Harris new 2-year deal
text:
Astros give All-Star Harris new 2-year deal Harris escapes jam with K 0:17 With a pair of runners in scoring position, Will Harris whiffs Leonys Martin to end the Mariners' scoring threat in the top of the 8th By Manny Randhawa / MLB.com | + 0 COMMENTS 
The Astros have avoided arbitration with right-hander Will Harris by agreeing to a two-year, $5 million deal, a source told MLB.com on Friday. 
The contract includes a club option for 2019. The club has not confirmed the deal. 
Harris, 32, posted a 2.25 ERA with 69 strikeouts in 66 appearances (64 innings) for Houston last season. He was selected to the National League All-Star team for the first time in his career. 
Harris pitched for the Rockies in 2012, and the D-backs from 2013-'14, before pitching for the Astros the past two seasons. is a reporter for MLB.com. Follow him on Twitter at @MannyOnMLB .
